intro: Farsetia fruticans, commonly known as the red-fruited farsetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its vining growth habit and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, fleshy, red berries. These berries are edible and often consumed by various bird species, aiding in seed dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in some tropical gardens.
